features: 14TB storage capacity Provides ample space for storing documents, photos, music and more.
USB 3.0 interface Offers an easy-to-use connection to devices. Backward compatible with USB 2.0 for simple connection to your computer.
Data transfer rates up to 5 Gbps with USB 3.0 Enable a rapid response when updating files.
Automatic backup options Allow you to use compatible software to back up your files to the server.
Compatible with Mac and PC For flexible installation options.
body.description: Easy, desktop backup and storage Help preserve your memories with easystore desktop storage. This USB 3.0 drive features WD Backup software. High capacity With up to 14TB* capacity, there’s plenty of storage space. Easy-to-Use Auto Backup Software easystore desktop storage comes equipped with WD Backup software. Simply download WD Backup software, plug in your drive and set your hourly, daily or monthly schedule. Time Machine compatibility** with Mac. Get More Out of WD Discovery Included WD Discovery software*** makes it easy to back up your photos, videos, and documents to the easystore desktop storage. WD Discovery software can also be used to manage your drive settings like reformatting, LED control and more. Universal connectivity With this drive, you get connectivity with USB 3.0 devices as well as backward compatibility with USB 2.0 devices. Built with WD reliability WD quality inside and out. For years, millions of people worldwide have trusted their data to WD hard drives. We are successful because we understand the importance of your data and are driven to help preserve your memories. Capacity 14 TB Interface USB 3.0 USB 2.0 Connector Micro B Compatibility Formatted NTFS Windows 10, Windows 8.1 or Windows 7 Reformatting required for macOS. Note: Compatibility may vary depending on user’s hardware configuration and operating system and requires reformatting for Time Machine Dimensions (L X W X H) 5.48" x 1.93" x 6.72" In The Box Desktop hard drive USB cable AC adapter WD Discovery software with WD Backup Quick install guide

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 105 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 12.7 TB after formatting.
reviews.reviewText: So far I have loaded this up with a little over 3 TB of music with plenty of room to spare. It has at times ran for 18 hours a day without any problems. I just plugged it into the USB on my Windows 10 desk top pc, then went to File Explorer > This PC > then right clicked the easystore (E) > Format, and it did the rest. It went from 14 TB to 12.7 after formatting the external hard drive. I took everything off my other smaller external hard drives and put it all on this one and still have extra space for years to come. So far no problems yet with this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Large storage, decent file transfer speed
reviews.reviewText: Using for media storage. Perfect for that

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good value at TB/$ for light-use drives...
reviews.reviewText: I bought several of these to migrate data from older drives. I've also bought at least a couple dozen other external Western Digital hard drives from their various product lines: My Book, Easy Book, etc... These are/were generally a good deal (when I bought them in mid-2022) at just under $250 for 14 TB (about 12.7 formatted capacity). That's less that $18 per Terabyte, which is a decent value, and a LOT cheaper than what you'd pay for most ANY internal 3.5" bare hard drive (which tend to be a lot pricier per TB, though most manufacturers put fairly cheap/light duty cycle drives in their externals). They're fine for light/normal use, long-term archiving of data, etc... but if you're going to need a heavy-use storage device and just run it 24hrs/day for months or years, you should get a more durable/expensive drive.Pros: fairly reliable (I've only had a couple of these go bad ever), good value, simple shiny black caseCons: IME, tech support from WD is not great if you need it, being over 5-6TB these drives require an AC adapter for power... smaller drives can get power from USBI've bought them before, and I'll probably buy more of them in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Largest size available

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars RUN AWAY FROM PRICISE AUTO CORP. DEFECTIVE, AND ZERO WARRANTY AFTER 30 DAYS!!!
reviews.reviewText: It is NOT plug-n-play on my computer! Have worked for 2 months trying to get it to work. Finally got it to recognize 1 TB.UPDATE: Sent it back for Warranty replacement. DENIED! They said it had been "Tamper with", which it had NOT!!! This is a drive that did NOT work, straight out of the box! I am not an electronics tech, opening it would void the warranty, I would not risk the warranty just to 'check inside'... chatted to Customer Support twice, trying to get it to work, to no avail. Contacting BBB for help!
